job_description:
• Perform electrical testing on packaged silicon devices using detailed test procedures to verify functionalityChange hardware and software setups on Automated Test Equipment (ATE) testers or bench systems as neededUtilize internal hardware test tools, internal software utilities, and third-party utilities to capture and report failuresCommunicate test failures to engineering and debug teams for further analysisRecord and document test results/data into various databases accuratelyComplete assigned tests within expected timeframes and according to customer/internal roadmap deadlinesEffectively manage multiple tasks under high-pressure situations to meet deadlines Solid understanding of semiconductor testing Experience with test tools such as curve tracer, oscilloscope, and data loggers Strong background in handling ESD-sensitive devices Experience using ATE testers such as Agilent, Advantest, or equivalent systems Solid soldering skills Proficient with MS Windows and Microsoft Office software (e.
• , Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Good organizational skills with the ability to multitask, prioritize, and track many activities Excels at working with minimal supervision and being able to lead others Superior interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written, with strong attention to detail AMD Partner Hub Authorized Distributors AMD University Program AAS Degree in Computer Engineering/Technology or equivalent training and experience Bachelor’s degree in related discipline Investor Relations Financial Information Board of Directors Governance Documents SEC Filings.
